member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.Commands.InteractiveWindowCommandExtensions.GetInteractiveCommands(Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.IInteractiveWindow)
member.summary:
Gets the IInteractiveWindowCommands instance for the current interactive window if one is defined.
Returns null if the interactive commands have not been created for this window.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.Commands.IInteractiveWindowCommand
member.summary:
Represents a command which can be run from a REPL window.
This interface is a MEF contract and can be implemented and exported to add commands to the REPL window.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.Commands.IInteractiveWindowCommand.Execute(Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.IInteractiveWindow,System.String)
member.summary: Asynchronously executes the command with specified arguments and calls back the given completion when finished.
member.returns: The task that completes the execution.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.Commands.IInteractiveWindowCommand.Description
member.summary: Gets a brief (ideally single-line) description of the REPL command which is displayed when the user asks for help.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.Commands.IInteractiveWindowCommand.CommandLine
member.summary: A single line parameters listing, or null if the command doesn't take any parameters. For example, "[on|off]".

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.Commands.IInteractiveWindowCommand.DetailedDescription
member.summary: Gets detailed description of the command usage.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.Commands.IInteractiveWindowCommand.ParametersDescription
member.summary: Parameter name and description for parameters of the command.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.Commands.IInteractiveWindowCommand.Names
member.summary: The name of the command. May not contain any whitespace characters.

member.summary: Provides classification for command arguments.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.Commands.InteractiveWindowCommand
member.summary:
Represents a command which can be run from a REPL window.
This interface is a MEF contract and can be implemented and exported to add commands to the REPL window.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.Commands.IInteractiveWindowCommands
member.summary: Provides handling of meta-commands in the interactive window. Instances can be created using the service.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.Commands.IInteractiveWindowCommands.InCommand
member.summary: Checks to see if the current input is in command mode (it is prefixed with the command prefix).

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.Commands.IInteractiveWindowCommands.CommandPrefix
member.summary: Gets the prefix which is used for interactive window commands.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.Commands.IInteractiveWindowCommands.TryExecuteCommand
member.summary:
Attempts to execute the command and returns the execution result.
Returns null if the current command is unrecognized.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.Commands.IInteractiveWindowCommands.GetCommands
member.summary: Gets the registered list of commands that this IInteractiveWindowCommands was created with.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.Commands.IInteractiveWindowCommands.Item(System.String)
member.summary: Gets an individual command by name.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.Commands.IInteractiveWindowCommands.DisplayCommandHelp(Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.Commands.IInteractiveWindowCommand)
member.summary: Displays help into the interactive window for the specified command.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.Commands.IInteractiveWindowCommands.DisplayCommandUsage(Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.Commands.IInteractiveWindowCommand,System.IO.TextWriter,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Displays usage information in the interactive window for the specified command.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.Commands.IInteractiveWindowCommands.DisplayHelp
member.summary: Displays help for all of the available commands.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.Commands.IInteractiveWindowCommands.Classify(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.SnapshotSpan)
member.summary: Classifies the specified command snapshot.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.Commands.IInteractiveWindowCommandsFactory
member.summary: Creates an which handles updating the context type for the command type, classification of commands, and execution of commands.
member.remarks:
Engines need to use this interface to respond to checks if code can be executed and to execute text when in a command mode.
The commands that are available for this interactive window are provided at creation time along with the prefix which commands should be prefaced with.

member.summary: Creates the IInteractiveCommands instance.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.CustomTrackingSpan
member.summary: This is a custom span which is like an EdgeInclusive span. We need a custom span because elision buffers do not allow EdgeInclusive unless it spans the entire buffer. We create snippets of our language spans and these are initially zero length. When we insert at the beginning of these we'll end up keeping the span zero length if we're just EdgePositive tracking.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.ExecutionResult
member.summary: The result of command execution.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.History.Entry._cachedText
member.summary: The cached text of this entry, which may exist if we've detached from the span.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.History.Entry._originalSpan
member.summary: The span of the original submission of this text.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.IInteractiveEvaluator
member.summary: Implements an evaluator for a specific REPL implementation. The evaluator is provided to the REPL implementation by the IInteractiveEngineProvider interface.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.IInteractiveEvaluator.CurrentWindow
member.summary: Gets or sets Interactive Window the engine is currently attached to.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.IInteractiveEvaluator.InitializeAsync
member.summary: Initializes the interactive session.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.IInteractiveEvaluator.ResetAsync(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Re-starts the interpreter. Usually this closes the current process (if alive) and starts a new interpreter.
member.returns: Task that completes reset and initialization of the new process.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.IInteractiveEvaluator.CanExecuteCode(System.String)
member.summary: Returns true if the text can be executed. Used to determine if there is a whole statement entered in the REPL window.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.IInteractiveEvaluator.ExecuteCodeAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Asynchronously executes the specified text.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.IInteractiveEvaluator.FormatClipboard
member.summary: Formats the contents of the clipboard in a manner reasonable for the language. Returns null if the current clipboard cannot be formatted.
member.remarks: By default if the clipboard contains text it will be pasted. The language can format additional forms here - for example CSV data can be formatted in a language compatible manner.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.IInteractiveEvaluator.AbortExecution
member.summary: Aborts the current running command.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.IInteractiveEvaluator.GetPrompt
member.summary: Retrieves the prompt string.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.IInteractiveWindow
member.summary:
An implementation of a Read Eval Print Loop Window for iteratively developing code.
Instances of the repl window can be created by using MEF to import the IInteractiveWindowProvider interface.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.IInteractiveWindow.TextView
member.summary: Gets the text view which the interactive window is running and writing output to.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.IInteractiveWindow.CurrentLanguageBuffer
member.summary: Gets the current language buffer.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.IInteractiveWindow.OutputBuffer
member.summary: Gets the output editor buffer.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.IInteractiveWindow.Evaluator
member.summary: The language evaluator used in Repl Window

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.IInteractiveWindow.InitializeAsync
member.summary: Initializes the execution environment and shows the initial prompt.
member.returns: Returns a started task that finishes as soon as the initialization completes.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.IInteractiveWindow.Close
member.summary: Closes the underlying text view.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.IInteractiveWindow.InsertCode(System.String)
member.summary: Insert the specified text to the active code buffer at the current caret position.
member.remarks:
Overwrites the current selection.
If the REPL is in the middle of code execution the text is inserted at the end of a pending input buffer. When the REPL is ready for input the pending input is inserted into the active code input.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.IInteractiveWindow.SubmitAsync(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Submits a sequence of inputs one by one.
member.param: Code snippets or REPL commands to submit.
member.remarks:
Enqueues given code snippets for submission at the earliest time the REPL is prepared to accept submissions. Any submissions are postponed until execution of the current submission (if there is any) is finished or aborted.
The REPL processes the given inputs one by one creating a prompt, input span and possibly output span for each input. This method may be reentered if any of the inputs evaluates to a command that invokes this method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.IInteractiveWindow.OutputWriter
member.summary:
Output writer.
REVIEW: Remove, other people can wrap Write APIS

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.IInteractiveWindow.ErrorOutputWriter
member.summary:
Error output writer.
REVIEW: Remove, other people can wrap Write APIS

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.IInteractiveWindow.WriteLine(System.String)
member.summary: Writes string followed by a line break into the output buffer.
member.param: Text to write. Might be null.
member.returns: The offset in the output subject buffer where the text is inserted and the length of the inserted text including the line break.
member.remarks: Note that the text might not be written to the editor buffer immediately but be buffered. The returned offsets might thus be beyond the current length of the editor buffer.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.IInteractiveWindow.Write(System.String)
member.summary: Writes a line into the output buffer.
member.param: Text to write. Might be null.
member.returns: The offset in the output subject buffer where the text is inserted.
member.remarks: Note that the text might not be written to the editor buffer immediately but be buffered. The returned offset might thus be beyond the current length of the editor buffer.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.IInteractiveWindow.Write(System.Windows.UIElement)
member.summary: Writes a UI object to the REPL window.
member.remarks: Flushes all text previously written to the output buffer before the element is inserted.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.IInteractiveWindow.ReadStandardInput
member.summary: Reads input from the REPL window.
member.returns: The entered input or null if cancelled.

member.name: E:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.IInteractiveWindow.ReadyForInput
member.summary: Event triggered when the REPL is ready to accept input.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.IInteractiveWindow.IsRunning
member.summary: True if there is currently an input being executed.
member.remarks: This value can only be reliably queried on the UI thread, otherwise the value is transient.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.IInteractiveWindow.IsResetting
member.summary: True if the interactive evaluator is currently resetting.
member.remarks: This value can only be reliably queried on the UI thread, otherwise the value is transient.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.IInteractiveWindow.IsInitializing
member.summary: True if the interactive evaluator is currently resetting.
member.remarks: This value can only be reliably queried on the UI thread, otherwise the value is transient.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.IInteractiveWindow.AddInput(System.String)
member.summary:
Appends a input into the editor buffer and history as if it has been executed.
The input is not executed.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.IInteractiveWindowEditorFactoryService
member.summary:
Implements the service that creates text views and buffers for the interactive window.
There is a single implementation of this service for each MEF composition catalog. The service understands how the editors and buffers need to be created and sets them up so that commands are properly routed to the editor window.
This service is imported by to use in the creation of s.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.IInteractiveWindowEditorFactoryService.CreateTextView(Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.IInteractiveWindow,Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.ITextBuffer,Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.Editor.ITextViewRoleSet)
member.summary: Creates a new text view for an interactive window.
member.param: The interactive window the text view is being created for.
The projection buffer used for displaying the interactive window

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.IInteractiveWindowEditorFactoryService.CreateAndActivateBuffer(Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.IInteractiveWindow)
member.summary: Creates a new input buffer for the interactive window.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.IInteractiveWindowFactoryService
member.summary: Creates instances of the IInteractiveWindow.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.IInteractiveWindowFactoryService.CreateWindow(Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.IInteractiveEvaluator)
member.summary: Creates a new interactive window which runs against the provided interactive evaluator.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.IInteractiveWindowOperations
member.summary: Provides access to low level editor operations on the REPL window.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.IInteractiveWindowOperations.Backspace
member.summary: Deletes the current selection or the character before the caret.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.IInteractiveWindowOperations.BreakLine
member.summary:
Attempts to insert a line break. Returns true if a line break is inserted, false if not.
Will not submit the input.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.IInteractiveWindowOperations.ClearHistory
member.summary: Clears the input history.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.IInteractiveWindowOperations.ClearView
member.summary: Clears the REPL window screen.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.IInteractiveWindowOperations.HistoryNext(System.String)
member.summary: Advances to the next item in history.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.IInteractiveWindowOperations.HistoryPrevious(System.String)
member.summary: Advanced to the previous item in history.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.IInteractiveWindowOperations.HistorySearchNext
member.summary: If no search has been performed captures the current input as the search string. Then searches through history for the next match against the current search string.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.IInteractiveWindowOperations.HistorySearchPrevious
member.summary: If no search has been performed captures the current input as the search string. Then searches through history for the previous match against the current search string.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.IInteractiveWindowOperations.Home(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Moves to the beginning of the line.
When in a language buffer the caret is moved to the beginning of the input region not into the prompt region.
The caret is moved to the first non-whitespace character.
member.param: True to extend the selection from the current caret position.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.IInteractiveWindowOperations.End(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Moves to the end of the line.
member.param: True to extend the selection from the current caret position.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.IInteractiveWindowOperations.SelectAll
member.summary: Selects all of the text in the buffer

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.IInteractiveWindowOperations.Paste
member.summary: Pastes the current clipboard contents into the interactive window.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.IInteractiveWindowOperations.Cut
member.summary: Cuts the current selection to the clipboard.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.IInteractiveWindowOperations.Delete
member.summary:
Deletes the current selection.
Returns true if the selection was deleted

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.IInteractiveWindowOperations.Return
member.summary:
Handles the user pressing return/enter.
If the caret is at the end of an input submits the current input. Otherwise if the caret is in a language buffer it inserts a newline.
If not inside of a buffer the caret well be moved to the current language buffer if possible.
Returns true if the return was successfully processed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.IInteractiveWindowOperations.TrySubmitStandardInput
member.summary:
If the current input is a standard input this will submit the input.
Returns true if the input was submitted, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.IInteractiveWindowOperations.ResetAsync(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Resets the execution context clearing all variables.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.IInteractiveWindowOperations.ExecuteInput
member.summary:
Executes the current input regardless of the caret position within the input.
If the caret is in a previously executed input then the input is pasted to the end of the current input and not executed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.IInteractiveWindowOperations.Cancel
member.summary: Clears the current input.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.InteractiveWindow
member.summary: Provides implementation of a Repl Window built on top of the VS editor using projection buffers.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.InteractiveWindow.Cancel
member.summary: Clears the current input

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.InteractiveWindow.Home(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Moves to the beginning of the line.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.InteractiveWindow.End(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Moves to the end of the line.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.InteractiveWindow.GetContainingRegion(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.SnapshotPoint)
member.summary:
Given a point in projection buffer calculate a span that includes the point and comprises of subsequent projection spans forming a region, i.e. a sequence of output spans in between two subsequent submissions, a language input block, or standard input block.
Internal for testing.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.InteractiveWindow.Paste
member.summary: Pastes from the clipboard into the text view

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.InteractiveWindow.IndentCurrentLine(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.SnapshotPoint)
member.summary: Indents the line where the caret is currently located.
member.remarks: We don't send this command to the editor since smart indentation doesn't work along with BufferChanged event. Instead, we need to implement indentation ourselves. We still use ISmartIndentProvider provided by the language.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.InteractiveWindow.DeletePreviousCharacter
member.summary: Deletes characters preceding the current caret position in the current language buffer.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.InteractiveWindow.CutOrDeleteSelection(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Deletes currently selected text from the language buffer and optionally saves it to the clipboard.

member.summary: Finds a point in an editable buffer that is the closest towards the end to the given projection point.

member.summary: Maps point to the current language buffer or standard input buffer.

member.summary: Returns the language or command text buffer that the specified point belongs to. If the point lays in a prompt returns the buffer corresponding to the prompt.
member.returns: The language or command buffer or null if the point doesn't belong to any.

member.summary: Returns the insertion point relative to the current language buffer.

member.summary: Returns the full text of the current active input.

member.summary: Sets the active code to the specified history entry.

member.summary: Appends given text to the last input span (standard input or active code input).

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.InteractiveWindow.AppendOutput(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.Int32)
member.summary: Appends text to the output buffer and updates projection buffer to include it. WARNING: this has to be the only method that writes to the output buffer so that the output buffering counters are kept in sync.

member.summary: Counts the number of line breaks in the text appended to the given snapshot.

member.summary: Enumerates input prompts that overlap given span. Returns an empty set if we are in the middle of operation changing the mapping and/or projection buffer.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.InteractiveWindow.MeasurePrompts(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Returns the lengths of the longest and shortest prompts within the specified range of lines of the current submission buffer.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.InteractiveWindow.GetClosestPrecedingInputSpan(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.SnapshotPoint,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Returns representing the closest language or stdin span preceding given point.
member.param: The index to of the primary prompt corresponding to the returned input span.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.InteractiveWindow.AddLanguageBuffer
member.summary: Creates and adds a new language buffer to the projection buffer.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.InteractiveWindow.CreateLanguageTrackingSpan(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.Span)
member.summary: Creates the language span for the last line of the active input. This span is effectively edge inclusive so it will grow as the user types at the end.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.InteractiveWindow.CreateNonGrowingLanguageTrackingSpan(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.Span)
member.summary: Creates the tracking span for a line previous in the input. This span is negative tracking on the end so when the user types at the beginning of the next line we don't grow with the change.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.InteractiveWindow.AddStandardInputSpan
member.summary: Add a zero-width tracking span at the end of the projection buffer mapping to the end of the standard input buffer.

member.summary: Marks the entire buffer as read-only.

member.summary: Removes read-only region from buffer.

member.summary:
Gets the interactive window associated with the text buffer if the text buffer is being hosted in the interactive window.
Returns null if the text buffer is not hosted in the interactive window.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.InteractiveWindowOptions.SmartUpDown
member.summary: Indicates that the window should be using smart up/down behavior. When enabled pressing the up or down arrow key will navigate history if the caret is at the end of the current input. When disabled the up/down arrow keys will always navigate the buffer.

member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The interactive window has already been initialized..

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.InteractiveWindowResources.DuplicateCommand
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to A command with the name '{0}' has already been registered..

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.InteractiveWindowResources.MissingCommandName
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to .

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.OutputBuffer
member.summary: Serializes and buffers output so that we avoid frequent switching to UI thread to write to the editor buffer.

member.summary: Flushes the buffer, should always be called from the UI thread.

member.summary: Classifies error text in interactive window output.

member.summary: The additional role found in any REPL editor window.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.PromptLineMapping

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.InteractiveWindow.PromptLineMapping.IsInconsistentWithProjections
member.summary: If true the map might not be consistent with projection spans. Used to work around the lack of an editor feature that would allow us to edit a subject buffer and projection spans atomically.

member.summary: Binary search for a prompt located on given line number. If no prompt is on the given line number returns the closest preceding prompt.
member.returns: An index in the prompt line map.

member.summary: The span represents output from the program (standard output)
